intro: Synandra, commonly known as the false holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. Synandra species typically have a woody stem and produce berries that are often red or black in color. They are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
